events.description: The release of the HCOB Spain Composite PMI data for January 2026, showing a decline to 52.9.

facts.fact_text: The HCOB Spain Composite PMI fell to 52.9 in January 2026 from 55.6 in December.

evidences.evidence_text: The HCOB Spain Composite PMI fell to 52.9 in January 2026 from 55.6 in December, marking the slowest pace of growth since last June.

facts.fact_text: Employment in Spain rose sharply, particularly in the services sector.

evidences.evidence_text: Employment, however, rose more sharply, driven by strong gains in the services sector.

facts.fact_text: Input cost inflation reached its highest level since August.

evidences.evidence_text: Input cost inflation accelerated to its highest level since August

claims.claim_text: Business confidence in the year-ahead outlook strengthened to a 12-month high.

evidences.evidence_text: Business confidence in the year-ahead outlook strengthened to a 12-month high.

evidence.evidence_text: Private sector new work expanded at a reduced rate, weighed down by a decline in manufacturing new orders
Employment, however, rose more sharply, driven by strong gains in the services sector.
Input cost inflation accelerated to its highest level since August, while output prices increased at the fastest pace in three months.
